intro: Fadogia oleoides, commonly known as African arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to western and central Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense spikes, followed by elongated pods containing several seeds. Fadogia oleoides is valued for its starchy roots, which are used as a food source and traditional medicine. Its ecological role includes supporting local biodiversity and serving as a resource for indigenous communities.
